pieces

Class PieceFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • pieces.PieceFactory

  • public class PieceFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    A class I created for creating Piece objects from certain parameters. This class may be useless and I need to re-evaluate it later.
    Author:
    marthaurion

    • Method Detail

      • createPiece

        public static Piece createPiece(java.lang.String s,
                int x,
                int y,
                PieceColor color,
                Board board)
        Creates a piece based on a string saying what kind of piece. Only supports None, Pawn, Knight, Bishop, Rook, Queen, and King.
        Parameters:
        s - Input String indicating piece type.
        x - The x-coordinate of the new Piece.
        y - The y-coordinate of the new Piece.
        color - Input PieceColor of the new Piece.
        board - Input Board object to hold the new Piece.
        Returns:
        Piece object for new piece or null if invalid string.

      • createPiece

        public static Piece createPiece(Piece p,
                Board b)
        Copies a piece.
        Parameters:
        p - Input Piece to be copied.
        b - Board object for the new Piece (doesn't have to be the same as the input Piece).
        Returns:
        Copy of input Piece. This should be a new object.
